member.name: T:TestShapeFile.GeometryType
member.summary: The GeometryType enumeration defines geometry types that can be used when creating WPF shapes. Choosing a stream geometry type can improve rendering performance.

member.name: F:TestShapeFile.GeometryType.UsePathGeometry
member.summary: Use path geometry containing path figures.

member.name: F:TestShapeFile.GeometryType.UseStreamGeometry
member.summary: Use StreamGeometry with StreamGeometryContext class to specify drawing instructions.

member.name: F:TestShapeFile.GeometryType.UseStreamGeometryNotStroked
member.summary: Same as UseStreamGeometry except that the figures will be unstroked for greater performance (borders won't be displayed for the shapes).

member.name: T:TestShapeFile.ShapeDisplay
member.summary: ShapeDisplay is a helper class for importing ESRI shapefiles and creating/displaying shapes on a WPF canvas. During the import step, a progress window is displayed. This is implemented using the WPF single-threaded programming model, which allows tasks to be executed by a Dispatcher instance while keeping the UI responsive.

member.name: M:TestShapeFile.ShapeDisplay.#ctor(System.Windows.Window,System.Windows.Controls.Canvas)
member.summary: Constructor for the ShapeDisplay class.
member.param: Window that acts as an owner to child windows.
The canvas on which to create WPF shapes.

member.name: M:TestShapeFile.ShapeDisplay.ReadShapeFile(System.String)
member.summary: Read shapes and attributes from the given shapefile.

member.name: M:TestShapeFile.ShapeDisplay.CancelReadShapeFile
member.summary: Request the current shapefile read operation to be cancelled.

member.name: M:TestShapeFile.ShapeDisplay.ResetCanvas
member.summary: Reset the canvas.

member.name: M:TestShapeFile.ShapeDisplay.Zoom(System.Double)
member.summary: Perform a zoom operation about the current center of the canvas.

member.name: M:TestShapeFile.ShapeDisplay.Pan(System.Double,System.Double)
member.summary: Perform a panning operation given X and Y factor values which can be thought of as a fraction of the canvas actual width or height.
member.param: Fraction of canvas actual width to pan horizontally.
Fraction of canvas actual height to pan vertically.

member.name: M:TestShapeFile.ShapeDisplay.SaveToXaml(System.IO.Stream)
member.summary: Save the owner object (the main window) to XAML. This method may take a long time to run if there are many objects on the canvas (shapefile > 1 Mb).
member.param: Output stream for writing the XAML.

member.name: M:TestShapeFile.ShapeDisplay.CreateShapeTransform(TestShapeFile.ShapeFileReadInfo)
member.summary: Computes a transformation so that the shapefile geometry will maximize the available space on the canvas and be perfectly centered as well.

member.name: M:TestShapeFile.ShapeDisplay.CreateShapeBrushes(System.Double,System.Double)
member.summary: Create a set of linear gradient brushes which we can use as a random pool for assignment to WPF shapes. A higher gradient factor results in a stronger gradient effect.

member.name: M:TestShapeFile.ShapeDisplay.GetAdjustedColor(System.Windows.Media.Color,System.Double)
member.summary: Given an input color, return an adjusted color using a factor value which ranges from 0 to 1. The larger the factor, the lighter the adjusted color. A factor of 0 means no adjustment to the input color.
member.remarks: Note that the alpha component of the input color is not adjusted.

member.name: M:TestShapeFile.ShapeDisplay.GetRandomShapeBrush
member.summary: Get the next brush that can be used to fill a WPF shape.

member.name: M:TestShapeFile.ShapeDisplay.ReadNextShapeRecord(TestShapeFile.ShapeFileReadInfo)
member.summary: Read a block of shape file records and possibly schedule the next read with the dispatcher.

member.name: M:TestShapeFile.ShapeDisplay.EndReadShapeFile
member.summary: Perform some cleanup at the end of reading a shapefile.

member.name: M:TestShapeFile.ShapeDisplay.EndReadShapeFile(TestShapeFile.ShapeFileReadInfo)
member.summary: Perform some cleanup at the end of reading a shapefile.

member.name: M:TestShapeFile.ShapeDisplay.ReadDbaseAttributes(TestShapeFile.ShapeFileReadInfo)
member.summary: Read dBASE file attributes.

member.summary: Create a WPF shape given a shapefile record.
member.param: The name of the WPF shape.

member.summary: Create a PathGeometry given a shapefile record.

member.name: M:TestShapeFile.ShapeDisplay.CreateStreamGeometry(TestShapeFile.ShapeFileRecord)
member.summary: Create a StreamGeometry given a shapefile record.

member.summary: Create a WPF shape to represent a shapefile point or multipoint record.
member.param: The name of the WPF shape.

member.summary: Begin creating and displaying WPF shapes on the canvas.

member.summary: Display a block of shape records as WPF shapes, and schedule the next display with the dispatcher if needed.

member.name: P:TestShapeFile.ShapeDisplay.IsReadingShapeFile
member.summary: Indicates if a shapefile read operation is in progress.

member.name: P:TestShapeFile.ShapeDisplay.CanZoom
member.summary: Indicates if we can perform a zoom operation. This is true the shape transform has been set (meaning at least one shapefile has been loaded).

member.name: P:TestShapeFile.ShapeDisplay.IsPanningEnabled
member.summary: Indicates if panning is enabled or not. This applies to both mouse and keyboard panning.

member.name: P:TestShapeFile.ShapeDisplay.IsDisplayLonLatEnabled
member.summary: Indicates if display of lon/lat coordinates is enabled or not.

member.name: P:TestShapeFile.ShapeDisplay.GeometryType
member.summary: Specifies the geometry type to use when creating WPF shapes.

member.name: T:TestShapeFile.ShapeDisplay.ReadNextPrototype
member.summary: Defines the prototype for a method that reads a block of shapefile records. Such a method is intended to be executed by the Dispatcher.

member.name: T:TestShapeFile.ShapeDisplay.DisplayNextPrototype
member.summary: Defines the prototype for a method that creates and displays a set of WPF shapes. Such a method is intended to be executed by the Dispatcher.

App

member.summary: Constructor for the App class.

member.summary: InitializeComponent

member.name: M:TestShapeFile.App.Main
member.summary: Application Entry Point.

member.name: T:TestShapeFile.ShapeType
member.summary: Enumeration defining the various shape types. Each shapefile contains only one type of shape (e.g., all polygons or all polylines).

member.name: F:TestShapeFile.ShapeType.NullShape
member.summary: Nullshape / placeholder record.

member.name: F:TestShapeFile.ShapeType.Point
member.summary: Point record, for defining point locations such as a city.

member.name: F:TestShapeFile.ShapeType.PolyLine
member.summary: One or more sets of connected points. Used to represent roads, hydrography, etc.

member.name: F:TestShapeFile.ShapeType.Polygon
member.summary: One or more sets of closed figures. Used to represent political boundaries for countries, lakes, etc.

member.name: F:TestShapeFile.ShapeType.Multipoint
member.summary: A cluster of points represented by a single shape record.

member.name: T:TestShapeFile.ShapeFileHeader
member.summary: The ShapeFileHeader class represents the contents of the fixed length, 100-byte file header at the beginning of every shapefile.

member.name: M:TestShapeFile.ShapeFileHeader.#ctor
member.summary: Constructor for the ShapeFileHeader class.

member.name: M:TestShapeFile.ShapeFileHeader.ToString
member.summary: Output some of the fields of the file header.
member.returns: A string representation of the file header.

member.name: P:TestShapeFile.ShapeFileHeader.Length
member.summary: Indicate the fixed-length of this header in bytes.

member.name: P:TestShapeFile.ShapeFileHeader.FileCode
member.summary: Specifies the file code for an ESRI shapefile, which should be the value, 9994.

member.name: P:TestShapeFile.ShapeFileHeader.FileLength
member.summary: Specifies the length of the shapefile, expressed as the number of 16-bit words in the file.

member.name: P:TestShapeFile.ShapeFileHeader.Version
member.summary: Specifies the shapefile version number.

member.name: P:TestShapeFile.ShapeFileHeader.ShapeType
member.summary: Specifies the shape type for the file. A shapefile contains only one type of shape.

member.name: P:TestShapeFile.ShapeFileHeader.XMin
member.summary: Indicates the minimum x-position of the bounding box for the shapefile (expressed in degrees longitude).

member.name: P:TestShapeFile.ShapeFileHeader.YMin
member.summary: Indicates the minimum y-position of the bounding box for the shapefile (expressed in degrees latitude).

member.name: P:TestShapeFile.ShapeFileHeader.XMax
member.summary: Indicates the maximum x-position of the bounding box for the shapefile (expressed in degrees longitude).

member.name: P:TestShapeFile.ShapeFileHeader.YMax
member.summary: Indicates the maximum y-position of the bounding box for the shapefile (expressed in degrees latitude).

member.name: T:TestShapeFile.ShapeFileRecord
member.summary: The ShapeFileRecord class represents the contents of a shape record, which is of variable length.

member.name: M:TestShapeFile.ShapeFileRecord.#ctor
member.summary: Constructor for the ShapeFileRecord class.

member.name: M:TestShapeFile.ShapeFileRecord.ToString
member.summary: Output some of the fields of the shapefile record.
member.returns: A string representation of the record.

member.name: P:TestShapeFile.ShapeFileRecord.RecordNumber
member.summary: Indicates the record number (or index) which starts at 1.

member.name: P:TestShapeFile.ShapeFileRecord.ContentLength
member.summary: Specifies the length of this shape record in 16-bit words.

member.name: P:TestShapeFile.ShapeFileRecord.ShapeType
member.summary: Specifies the shape type for this record.

member.name: P:TestShapeFile.ShapeFileRecord.XMin
member.summary: Indicates the minimum x-position of the bounding box for the shape (expressed in degrees longitude).

member.name: P:TestShapeFile.ShapeFileRecord.YMin
member.summary: Indicates the minimum y-position of the bounding box for the shape (expressed in degrees latitude).

member.name: P:TestShapeFile.ShapeFileRecord.XMax
member.summary: Indicates the maximum x-position of the bounding box for the shape (expressed in degrees longitude).

member.name: P:TestShapeFile.ShapeFileRecord.YMax
member.summary: Indicates the maximum y-position of the bounding box for the shape (expressed in degrees latitude).

member.name: P:TestShapeFile.ShapeFileRecord.NumberOfParts
member.summary: Indicates the number of parts for this shape. A part is a connected set of points, analogous to a PathFigure in WPF.

member.name: P:TestShapeFile.ShapeFileRecord.NumberOfPoints
member.summary: Specifies the total number of points defining this shape record.

member.name: P:TestShapeFile.ShapeFileRecord.Parts
member.summary: A collection of indices for the points array. Each index identifies the starting point of the corresponding part (or PathFigure using WPF terminology).

member.name: P:TestShapeFile.ShapeFileRecord.Points
member.summary: A collection of all of the points defining the shape record.

member.name: P:TestShapeFile.ShapeFileRecord.Attributes
member.summary: Access the (dBASE) attribute values associated with this shape record.

member.name: T:TestShapeFile.ShapeFileReadInfo
member.summary: The ShapeFileReadInfo class stores information about a shapefile that can be used by external clients during a shapefile read.

member.name: M:TestShapeFile.ShapeFileReadInfo.#ctor
member.summary: Constructor for the ShapeFileReadInfo class.

member.name: M:TestShapeFile.ShapeFileReadInfo.ToString
member.summary: Output some of the field values in the form of a string.
member.returns: A string representation of the field values.

member.name: P:TestShapeFile.ShapeFileReadInfo.FileName
member.summary: The full pathname of the shapefile.

member.name: P:TestShapeFile.ShapeFileReadInfo.ShapeFile
member.summary: A reference to the shapefile instance.

member.name: P:TestShapeFile.ShapeFileReadInfo.Stream
member.summary: An opened file stream for a shapefile.

member.name: P:TestShapeFile.ShapeFileReadInfo.NumberOfBytesRead
member.summary: The number of bytes read from a shapefile so far. Can be used to compute a progress value.

member.name: P:TestShapeFile.ShapeFileReadInfo.RecordIndex
member.summary: A general-purpose record index.

member.name: T:TestShapeFile.ShapeFile
member.summary: The ShapeFile class represents the contents of a single ESRI shapefile. This is the class which contains functionality for reading shapefiles and their corresponding dBASE attribute files.
member.remarks: You can call the Read() method to import both shapes and attributes at once. Or, you can open the file stream yourself and read the file header or individual records one at a time. The advantage of this is that it allows you to implement your own progress reporting functionality, for example.

member.name: M:TestShapeFile.ShapeFile.#ctor
member.summary: Constructor for the ShapeFile class.

member.name: M:TestShapeFile.ShapeFile.Read(System.String)
member.summary: Read both shapes and attributes from the given shapefile (and its corresponding dBASE file). This is the top-level method for reading an ESRI shapefile.

member.name: M:TestShapeFile.ShapeFile.ReadShapes(System.String)
member.summary: Read shapes (geometry) from the given shapefile.

member.name: M:TestShapeFile.ShapeFile.ReadShapes(System.IO.Stream)
member.summary: Read shapes (geometry) from the given stream.

member.name: M:TestShapeFile.ShapeFile.ReadShapeFileHeader(System.IO.Stream)
member.summary: Read the file header of the shapefile.

member.name: M:TestShapeFile.ShapeFile.ReadShapeFileRecord(System.IO.Stream)
member.summary: Read a shapefile record.

member.name: M:TestShapeFile.ShapeFile.ReadAttributes(System.String)
member.summary: Read the table from specified dBASE (DBF) file and merge the rows with shapefile records.
member.remarks: The filename of the dBASE file is expected to follow 8.3 naming conventions. If it doesn't follow the convention, we try to determine the 8.3 short name ourselves (but the name we come up with may not be correct in all cases).
member.param: Full file path of the dBASE (DBF) file.

member.name: M:TestShapeFile.ShapeFile.ToString
member.summary: Output the File Header in the form of a string.
member.returns: A string representation of the file header.

member.name: M:TestShapeFile.ShapeFile.ReadInt32_LE(System.IO.Stream)
member.summary: Read a 4-byte integer using little endian (Intel) byte ordering.

member.name: M:TestShapeFile.ShapeFile.ReadInt32_BE(System.IO.Stream)
member.summary: Read a 4-byte integer using big endian byte ordering.

member.name: M:TestShapeFile.ShapeFile.ReadDouble64_LE(System.IO.Stream)
member.summary: Read an 8-byte double using little endian (Intel) byte ordering.

member.name: M:TestShapeFile.ShapeFile.ReadPoint(System.IO.Stream,TestShapeFile.ShapeFileRecord)
member.summary: Read a shapefile Point record.

member.name: M:TestShapeFile.ShapeFile.ReadMultipoint(System.IO.Stream,TestShapeFile.ShapeFileRecord)
member.summary: Read a shapefile MultiPoint record.

member.name: M:TestShapeFile.ShapeFile.ReadPolygon(System.IO.Stream,TestShapeFile.ShapeFileRecord)
member.summary: Read a shapefile Polygon record.

member.name: M:TestShapeFile.ShapeFile.MergeAttributes(System.Data.DataTable)
member.summary: Merge data rows from the given table with the shapefile records.

member.name: P:TestShapeFile.ShapeFile.FileHeader
member.summary: Access the file header of this shapefile.

member.name: P:TestShapeFile.ShapeFile.Records
member.summary: Access the collection of records for this shapefile.
